page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF THORNSETT
page.content: When you come in to Thornsett it is a little village with one post Office. There is a school there which is over a 100 years old. As you pass the school there are lots and lots of fields and down at the bottom of some of the fields there is a stream which is called Golden Springs.It is quite stoney. Up from the stream there is a farm it has kennels. Near the farm is a wood it is called Wimberry wood, there is a house in the middle of the wood. Down Aspenshaw Rd you come to a little cobbled path called Doctors End because there used to be a row of houses there,and at the end house lived a Doctor. Now there are daffodils that Thornsett School planted two years ago.Along the road past Pump row is a pub called the Printers Arms and Thornsett bandroom.
